channel.title: Computer acting up
channel.description:
So I've been having this problem for a while now. Sometimes when I start up my computer I get an error saying "Windows could not access user profile service". After I restart my computer 2-4 times it logs on properly. I only have one administrative account that I run and have no idea whats going on. If this helps, task manager stops/shuts down all the services and processes and does not allow me to turn on or run any of them.
Does anyone have any clues? Thanks.

item.title: Computer acting up
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:8, topic:352189”]So what would I need to do to take the DRIVE:/PROGRAM FILES to the other account, because I’m pretty sure all can work with multiple accounts.[/quote]umm nothing… Drive:/Program Files is accessible to any user

Read full topic

item.title: Computer acting up
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

So what would I need to do to take the DRIVE:/PROGRAM FILES to the other account, because I’m pretty sure all can work with multiple accounts.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer acting up
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:5, topic:352189”]Copy and paste what?
I’m talking about files and programs, I thought that was implied.[/quote]as was said, you just copy and paste files. for programs, they are just in Drive:/Program Files, although you might have setup some programs to be used only by one account, which means that some registry entries might be pointing to the user account’s files, so just open up regedit and modify 'em

Read full topic

item.title: Computer acting up
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:5, topic:352189”]Copy and paste what?
I’m talking about files and programs, I thought that was implied.[/quote]
Yes, you copy the files and programs from the old profile to the new one, you don’t need to be a computer scientist to do that.

Read full topic

I’m talking about files and programs, I thought that was implied.

item.title: Computer acting up
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

cows_be_sacred:

It isn’t a virus, I was reading some site and it said that the profile user is corrupt, and that I should just make a new user. But I’m not sure, how would I transfer the files I need?

Copy AND paste.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer acting up

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

So I’ve been having this problem for a while now. Sometimes when I start up my computer I get an error saying
“Windows could not access user profile service”. After I restart my computer 2-4 times it logs on properly. I only have one administrative account that I run and have no idea whats going on. If this helps, task manager stops/shuts down all the services and processes and does not allow me to turn on or run any of them.

Does anyone have any clues? Thanks.
